text: Hardin is an unincorporated community in Shelby County, Ohio. ==History== Hardin was platted in 1816. The community was named for John Hardin (1753â€“1792), a Continental Army officer in the American Revolutionary War. Hardin was the county seat from 1819 until 1820. A post office called Hardin was established in 1820, and discontinued in 1909. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Ohio
title: Hardin, Ohio
